Package entities

Class Room

java.lang.Object
entities.Room
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Room>
public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Room>
Represents a room in a game or simulation. A room has a unique name and attributes to track the presence of items and enemies, as well as the total count of each. Rooms can be compared based on their unique names.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Room​(java.lang.String name)
    Constructs a new Room object with a specified unique name.

  • Constructor Details

    • Room

      public Room​(java.lang.String name)
      Constructs a new Room object with a specified unique name. Initializes the room with no enemies or items present.
      Parameters:
      name - the unique identifier for the room

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Retrieves the unique name of the room.
      Returns:
      the name of the room as a String

    • setEnemies

      public void setEnemies​(boolean enemiesInRoom)
      Updates the status of whether enemies are currently present in the room.
      Parameters:
      enemiesInRoom - a boolean indicating the presence of enemies in the room. Set to true if enemies are present, otherwise false.

    • setItemsInRoom

      public void setItemsInRoom​(boolean itemsInRoom)
      Updates the status of whether items are currently present in the room.
      Parameters:
      itemsInRoom - a boolean indicating the presence of items in the room. Set to true if items are present, otherwise false.

    • addEnemy

      public void addEnemy()
      Increments the total number of enemies in the room by one. This method is used to update the count of enemies whenever an enemy is added to the room.

    • removeEnemy

      public void removeEnemy()
      Decrements the total number of enemies in the room by one. This method is typically used to update the enemy count when an enemy is removed from the room.

    • addItem

      public void addItem()
      Increments the total number of items in the room by one. This method is typically used to update the count of items whenever a new item is added to the room.

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem()
      Decrements the total number of items in the room by one. This method is typically used to update the count of items when an item is removed or picked up from the room.

    • getTotalEnemies

      public int getTotalEnemies()
      Retrieves the total number of enemies present in the room.
      Returns:
      the total number of enemies in the room as an integer.

    • getTotalItems

      public int getTotalItems()
      Retrieves the total number of items present in the room.
      Returns:
      the total number of items in the room as an integer.

    • hasItems

      public boolean hasItems()
      Checks whether the room contains any items.
      Returns:
      true if there are items present in the room, false otherwise.

    • hasEnemies

      public boolean hasEnemies()
      Checks whether there are currently any enemies present in the room.
      Returns:
      true if enemies are present in the room, false otherwise.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Room other)
      Compares this Room object with the specified Room object for order. The comparison is based on the lexicographical order of the room names.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Room>
      Parameters:
      other - the Room object to be compared with this Room.
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if the name of this Room

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the room. This representation includes the unique name of the room.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the name of the room as a string.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Compares this Room object to the specified object to determine equality. Two Room objects are considered equal if they have the same name.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be compared for equality with this Room
      Returns:
      true if the specified object is equal to this Room, false otherwise
